content.body: quick take: "whitespace" has never seemed problematic to me because (I believe) the origin was literal white space on paper, from the era of the printing press

content.body: in general I think that we should not be in the business of arbitrating whether someone's discomfort with a term has merit, nor respond in a way that makes it look like we are setting ourselves up as the arbitrators of that. which a lot of people tried to do with "master branch" [edit: not talking about TC39 specifically here, just People On The Internet]

content.body: that said, this would be the first I've heard of anyone having a problem with "whitespace"
